author: Rik L. Hix

review: I purchased this mainly because I got it on special and wanted to try it out. My hope was that I could use it to replace the PC in my basement entertainment system that kept losing it's wired ethernet connection. When I first opened it I thought it was fine, and disconnected my Chromecast to set it up on my livingroom TV. The setup went fine and updates installed. After using it for a couple of hours it dropped my WiFi connection and would not reconnect. I did a factory reset which didn't fix the issue, so I disconnected it in favor of my Chromecast.A couple of weeks later I brought it into the basement and tried again. When I turned to the input for it, I was greeted by the boot animation, the screen went dark, and I was greeted with the boot animation again, and then again, and again. I thought maybe it was doing updates, so I turned over to the game and forgot about it. Three hours later it was still looping. I tried it again upstairs, and it did the same thing. Overall it lasted for about two hours of use. Today I processed a return, and used the credit to get a decent WiFi dongle for my PC in the basement.Final thoughts:If you have a "dumb" TV and want to make it Smart, this is the best stand-alone solution for under $50. If you have the means and the know-how, go and piece together a cheap used PC (I can consistently take a working free used PC and turn it into a home theater PC for under $100, I've done this 3 or 4 times for myself and to give as gifts) and you will have a device that can do more than any stick or set-top box.
